protocol_name: DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
protocol_name_html: DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
description: A very detailed four-day protocol for DNA extraction for yeast PacBio sequencing modified from Promega's protocol for yeast p13-14.
before_start: Future improvements: This is a mini-prep kit for DNA extractions from 1.5ml of yeast culture. Consider using a midi-prep kit for higher yield without needing 8 reactions per strain.
warning: See SDS (Safety Data Sheet) for warnings and safety hazards.

groups.group_name: MinION user group for high molecular weight DNA extraction from all kingdoms

guidelines:
Promega's Wizard® Genomic DNA Purification Kit

Wizard® Genomic DNA Purification Kit (Catalog number: A1125) Other reagents:

  • 0.5M EDTA (Life Technologies, Catalogue number: AM9260G). Dilute 1:10 for 50mM EDTA.
  • lyticase (Sigma, Catalogue number: L2524-50KU). For a 25 units/ul stock, suspend in 2ml UltraPure H2O and dispense into 2x 1ml aliquots, store at -20C

Note: This is a very detailed protocol because it is actually just our standard lab protocol x 8 with a couple of extra steps to increase purity for PacBio.

 

Modified from Promega's protocol for yeast p13-14:

 

Some of the changes to our standard protocol might have been unnecessary e.g. We spun samples at 16,162g and for longer than suggested: for 10 minutes after the addition of Nuclei Lysis Solution (Promega) and Protein Precipitation Solution (Promega); for 10 minutes after DNA precipitation with isopropanol; and for 5 minutes after washing the DNA pellet with 70% ethanol. I am not sure the extra time on spins is really necessary if you know your centrifuge is good: we had just had problems with a lab centrifuge, which lowered DNA quality and yield.
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working. A couple of other labs have also used it successfully.

components.data: For each strain, inoculate 15 ml YPD in 50 ml Falcon tubes from single colonies on YPD plates using a sterile inoculation loop.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: For each strain, inoculate 15 ml YPD in 50 ml Falcon tubes from single colonies on YPD plates using a sterile inoculation loop.

components.data: Incubate at overnight at 30°C (for at least 20 hours, e.g. 24 hours).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate at overnight at 30°C (for at least 20 hours, e.g. 24 hours).

components.data:
Take 1.4 ml of each overnight culture and add to a 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube.

 

*Do this a total of 8 times for each strain (so there are 8 microcentrifuge tubes for each strain).
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Take 1.4 ml of each overnight culture and add to a 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube.

 

*Do this a total of 8 times for each strain (so there are 8 microcentrifuge tubes for each strain).

components.data: Centrifuge at high speed (14,000 rpm on Eppendorf centrifuge or 16,162g on other) for 2 minutes to pellet the cells.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at high speed (14,000 rpm on Eppendorf centrifuge or 16,162g on other) for 2 minutes to pellet the cells.

components.data: Remove and discard the supernatant into a yeast waste jar containing Virkon solution (make this up with Virkon powder and water to a deep pink color).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove and discard the supernatant into a yeast waste jar containing Virkon solution (make this up with Virkon powder and water to a deep pink color).

components.data: Pipette to resuspend the pellet in 296 µl 50mM EDTA pH 8.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pipette to resuspend the pellet in 296 µl 50mM EDTA pH 8.

components.data: Add 4 µl Lyticase (25U/ul, diluted stock from Sigma) and incubate overnight at 37°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 4 µl Lyticase (25U/ul, diluted stock from Sigma) and incubate overnight at 37°C.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 7 of DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
source_data.protocol_name: DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
source_data.protocol_name_html: DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
source_data.annotation: We used only 100 units of lyticase (Sigma, L2524) in an overnight incubation at 37 °C to save money (past experiments showed no change in yield).
source_data.thread_text: We used only 100 units of lyticase (Sigma, L2524) in an overnight incubation at 37 °C to save money (past experiments showed no change in yield).
source_data.body: We used only 100 units of lyticase (Sigma, L2524) in an overnight incubation at 37 °C to save money (past experiments showed no change in yield).

source_data.description: Centrifuge the sample at 16,162g for 2 mins.
Remove and discard the supernatant.
Add 300 µl Promega Nuclei Lysis Solution.

components.data: Add 100 µl Promega Protein Precipitation Solution. Stir with the pipette tip and pipette up and down to resuspend the pellet.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 100 µl Promega Protein Precipitation Solution. Stir with the pipette tip and pipette up and down to resuspend the pellet.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 11 of DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
source_data.protocol_name: DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
source_data.protocol_name_html: DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
source_data.annotation: The combination of Protein Precipitation Solution and Nuclei Lysis Solution makes the mixture cloudy (not the pellet or protein).
source_data.thread_text: The combination of Protein Precipitation Solution and Nuclei Lysis Solution makes the mixture cloudy (not the pellet or protein).
source_data.body: The combination of Protein Precipitation Solution and Nuclei Lysis Solution makes the mixture cloudy (not the pellet or protein).

components.data: Let the sample sit on ice for 5-30 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Let the sample sit on ice for 5-30 minutes.
Centrifuge at high speed for 10 minutes.

components.data: Carefully pipette the supernatant to a clean 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube containing 300 µl Isopropanol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Carefully pipette the supernatant to a clean 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube containing 300 µl Isopropanol.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 14 of DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
source_data.protocol_name: DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
source_data.protocol_name_html: DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
source_data.annotation: Be careful to avoid the protein pellet and leave some residual liquid to avoid contaminating the DNA solution.
source_data.thread_text: Be careful to avoid the protein pellet and leave some residual liquid to avoid contaminating the DNA solution.
source_data.body: Be careful to avoid the protein pellet and leave some residual liquid to avoid contaminating the DNA solution.

components.data: Invert the samples 50 times, and a wispy mass might be visible.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Invert the samples 50 times, and a wispy mass might be visible.
Centrifuge at high speed for 10 minutes.

components.data:
• Carefully pipette off and discard the supernatant without dislodging the pellet.
  • Drain the tube on clean absorbent paper. At this stage, you should see a pellet for all samples except negative controls (if you see a pellet in the negatives, then this is probably not DNA and will be purified away in subsequent steps).
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
• Carefully pipette off and discard the supernatant without dislodging the pellet.
  • Drain the tube on clean absorbent paper. At this stage, you should see a pellet for all samples except negative controls (if you see a pellet in the negatives, then this is probably not DNA and will be purified away in subsequent steps).

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 17 of DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
source_data.protocol_name: DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
source_data.protocol_name_html: DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
source_data.annotation: If the pellet is dislodged during the removal of the supernatant, respin the sample. You may need to leave some residual liquid in the tube to avoid dislodging the pellet (the pellet after the ethanol wash below will be whiter and less easy to dislodge).
source_data.thread_text: If the pellet is dislodged during the removal of the supernatant, respin the sample. You may need to leave some residual liquid in the tube to avoid dislodging the pellet (the pellet after the ethanol wash below will be whiter and less easy to dislodge).
source_data.body: If the pellet is dislodged during the removal of the supernatant, respin the sample. You may need to leave some residual liquid in the tube to avoid dislodging the pellet (the pellet after the ethanol wash below will be whiter and less easy to dislodge).

components.data: Add 300 μl of room temperature 70% ethanol and gently invert the tube 20 times to wash the DNA pellet.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 300 μl of room temperature 70% ethanol and gently invert the tube 20 times to wash the DNA pellet.

components.data: Centrifuge at 16,162g for 5 mins. Carefully pipette off all the ethanol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at 16,162g for 5 mins. Carefully pipette off all the ethanol.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 19 of DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
source_data.protocol_name: DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
source_data.protocol_name_html: DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
source_data.annotation: Note: the pellet at this stage contains impurities, so the size (or visibility) of the pellet is not an indicator of final yield.
source_data.thread_text: Note: the pellet at this stage contains impurities, so the size (or visibility) of the pellet is not an indicator of final yield.
source_data.body: Note: the pellet at this stage contains impurities, so the size (or visibility) of the pellet is not an indicator of final yield.

components.data: Drain the tube on clean absorbent paper, and allow the pellet to air dry for 15 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Drain the tube on clean absorbent paper, and allow the pellet to air dry for 15 minutes.

components.data: Add 25 µl Promega DNA rehydration solution, and gently resuspend the pellet by pipetting.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 25 µl Promega DNA rehydration solution, and gently resuspend the pellet by pipetting.

components.data: Add 1.5 µl of Promega RNase solution and pipette to mix the RNase into each sample.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 1.5 µl of Promega RNase solution and pipette to mix the RNase into each sample.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 22 of DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
source_data.protocol_name: DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
source_data.protocol_name_html: DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
source_data.annotation: Also, a 1:2 dilution of the RNase solution from Qiagen (i.e. 5.25 units, Qiagen, Cat. no. 19101) can be used in place of the Promega RNase solution.
source_data.thread_text: Also, a 1:2 dilution of the RNase solution from Qiagen (i.e. 5.25 units, Qiagen, Cat. no. 19101) can be used in place of the Promega RNase solution.
source_data.body: Also, a 1:2 dilution of the RNase solution from Qiagen (i.e. 5.25 units, Qiagen, Cat. no. 19101) can be used in place of the Promega RNase solution.

source_data.description: Incubate at 37°C for 1-2 hours.

components.data: Vortex for 1 second, and spin quickly to collect liquid.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Vortex for 1 second, and spin quickly to collect liquid.

components.data: Leave at room temperature overnight, then store DNA extracts in the fridge at 2-8°C until ready for ethanol precipitation (could be several days later).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Leave at room temperature overnight, then store DNA extracts in the fridge at 2-8°C until ready for ethanol precipitation (could be several days later).

components.data: Check yield of every sample on gel. If all samples give a good yield for each strain, then it is ok to pool them all. Discard any samples where 1 µl is not visible on a gel.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Check yield of every sample on gel. If all samples give a good yield for each strain, then it is ok to pool them all. Discard any samples where 1 µl is not visible on a gel.

components.data: Pool samples for each strain and remove RNA from purified DNA.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pool samples for each strain and remove RNA from purified DNA.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 27 of DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
source_data.protocol_name: DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
source_data.protocol_name_html: DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
source_data.annotation:
(modified from Qiagen's protocol, Apendix D)

 

*I am pretty sure any ethanol precipitation protocol would be fine here. I only used the protocol and 'Protein Precipitation Solution' from Qiagen because it was to hand.
source_data.thread_text:
(modified from Qiagen's protocol, Apendix D)

 

*I am pretty sure any ethanol precipitation protocol would be fine here. I only used the protocol and 'Protein Precipitation Solution' from Qiagen because it was to hand.
source_data.body:
(modified from Qiagen's protocol, Apendix D)

 

*I am pretty sure any ethanol precipitation protocol would be fine here. I only used the protocol and 'Protein Precipitation Solution' from Qiagen because it was to hand.

components.data: Cool DNA extracts 15 minutes on ice.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cool DNA extracts 15 minutes on ice.
Spin at high speed for 10 minutes.

components.data: Pool the supernatants of the four extracts for each strain into a fresh tube, bringing the final volume for each strain to approximately 180 μl.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pool the supernatants of the four extracts for each strain into a fresh tube, bringing the final volume for each strain to approximately 180 μl.

components.data: Add 20 μl (or other amounts) of Promega (or Qiagen's) DNA Hydration solution, bringing the final volume of DNA extract up to 200 μl for each strain.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 20 μl (or other amounts) of Promega (or Qiagen's) DNA Hydration solution, bringing the final volume of DNA extract up to 200 μl for each strain.

components.data: Add 6 μl RNase A from Promega (or 3 μl RNase A Solution from Qiagen), mix by pipetting, quick 1 second vortex and spin.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 6 μl RNase A from Promega (or 3 μl RNase A Solution from Qiagen), mix by pipetting, quick 1 second vortex and spin.

components.data: Incubate at 37°C for 1 hour, then transfer to ice.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate at 37°C for 1 hour, then transfer to ice.

components.data: Add 100 μl Promega (or Qiagen) Protein Precipitation Solution (0.5 volume), 400 μl 96-100% Ethanol from freezer (2 volumes).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 100 μl Promega (or Qiagen) Protein Precipitation Solution (0.5 volume), 400 μl 96-100% Ethanol from freezer (2 volumes).

components.data: Mix by inverting 50 times (visible mass formed in all except negatives). Leave on ice for 15 mins.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix by inverting 50 times (visible mass formed in all except negatives). Leave on ice for 15 mins.
Centrifuge at high speed for 10 minutes.
Carefully, pipette off supernatant.
Add 600 μl room temperature 70% ethanol (3 volumes).
Centrifuge at high speed for 3 minutes.

components.data: Carefully, pipette off and discard supernatant and air dry the pellet for 15 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Carefully, pipette off and discard supernatant and air dry the pellet for 15 minutes.

components.data: Resuspend pellet in 110 μl Qiagen DNA Hydration Solution (1xTE) by gentle pipetting.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend pellet in 110 μl Qiagen DNA Hydration Solution (1xTE) by gentle pipetting.

components.data: Incubation at 37 ºC for 1-1.5 hours to fully dissolve the DNA.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubation at 37 ºC for 1-1.5 hours to fully dissolve the DNA.

components.data: Quick spin, pipette to mix, 15 minutes at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Quick spin, pipette to mix, 15 minutes at room temperature.

components.data: Centrifuge at high speed for 10 minutes in order to pellet any impurities that might have precipitated together with the DNA.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at high speed for 10 minutes in order to pellet any impurities that might have precipitated together with the DNA.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 44 of DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
source_data.protocol_name: DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
source_data.protocol_name_html: DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
source_data.annotation: The DNA should now be fully dissolved and will no longer form a pellet.
source_data.thread_text: The DNA should now be fully dissolved and will no longer form a pellet.
source_data.body: The DNA should now be fully dissolved and will no longer form a pellet.

components.data: Transfer the supernatants to new tubes (even though no pellets were visible at this stage).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer the supernatants to new tubes (even though no pellets were visible at this stage).

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 45 of DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
source_data.protocol_name: DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
source_data.protocol_name_html: DNA extraction protocol for yeast PacBio sequencing
source_data.annotation: The quality and quantity of DNA was assessed by running alongside a high molecular weight ladder (GeneRuler High Range DNA Ladder, SM1351) on a 0.5% agarose gel stained with 1x Gel Red in 1x TAE buffer, by NanoDrop, and using a Qubit fluorometer.
source_data.thread_text: The quality and quantity of DNA was assessed by running alongside a high molecular weight ladder (GeneRuler High Range DNA Ladder, SM1351) on a 0.5% agarose gel stained with 1x Gel Red in 1x TAE buffer, by NanoDrop, and using a Qubit fluorometer.
source_data.body: The quality and quantity of DNA was assessed by running alongside a high molecular weight ladder (GeneRuler High Range DNA Ladder, SM1351) on a 0.5% agarose gel stained with 1x Gel Red in 1x TAE buffer, by NanoDrop, and using a Qubit fluorometer.
